numerals.found_text: This diagram illustrates the VACM ECEU (Extraction, Compaction, Expansion, and UMLS API) workflow. Medical concepts are extracted from eCFR data, as shown in the above figure, and processed through an LLM to generate relevant medical keywords such as "Echocardiography," "Prednisone," and "Complete blood count." The expanded keywords are then mapped to standardized medical codes using the UMLS API, resulting in ICD-10 codes (e.g., R50.9 for Fever), CPT codes (e.g., 93306 for Echocardiography), RxNorm codes (e.g., 8640 for Prednisone), and LOINC codes (e.g., 718-7 for Complete Blood Count).

numerals.found_text: Figure 29â€“ This stacked bar chart compares the performance of four embedding models - text-embedding-ada-002, BioBERT, PubMedBERT, and all-MiniLM-L6-v2 - in aligning ICD-10 code descriptions with the ECFR description of VASRD Code: 6846 (Sarcoidosis) using cosine similarity. Each bar represents 147 ICD-10 codes split into 'Matched Codes' (blue) and 'Missing Codes' (dark blue). text-embedding-ada-002 achieved 33 matches, all-MiniLM-L6-v2 had 28 matches, while BioBERT and PubMedBERT each matched only 1 code. PubMedBERT and BioBERT yielded fewer matches in the top 200 results because their embeddings focus on biomedical text, which may not align well with the regulatory and clinical language in the ECFR description, resulting in weaker semantic connections

numerals.found_text: Figure 31Â â€“ Euclidean distance is used to measure the similarity between two points. In this analysis, vector embeddings were generated for the Sarcoidosis ECFR description and approximately 75,000 ICD-10 code descriptions using the text-embedding-3-large. Without applying normalization orÂ dimensionality reduction, the L2 norm isÂ calculated. ICD-10 Codes were sorted based on their L2 norm scores, with lower scores indicating higher similarity. The top 200 codes with the lowest L2 norm scores were compared to a curated list of 147 Sarcoidosis-related ICD-10 codes. Among the top 200 codes, 20 matched the curated list, and in the top 500, 29 codes matched.Â While the match is limited, refining the ECFR description by incorporating all known symptoms of Sarcoidosis using a LLM has the potential to improve the relevance and accuracy of the results.

numerals.found_text: Figure 32Â -Â  In our analysis, Euclidean distance serves as a key metric to evaluate the semantic relationship between Sarcoidosis (Condition) and ICD-10 code descriptions across two distinct datasets: API output results and Hannah's codes. The API output encompasses 2,564 codes, while Hannah's dataset contains 147 thoroughly validated codes. Our Euclidean distance calculations revealed a distribution ranging from 0.4754 to 0.7904 in the API dataset and 0.4754 to 0.7617 in Hannah's dataset. Notably, the overlapping distance ranges indicate that Euclidean distance,Â may not provide optimal differentiation for identifying the 147 validated codes within the broader API Output Results.

numerals.found_text: Figure 34Â â€“ The image shows the Voronoi polygon for Sarcoidosis.Â Voronoi is performed for 6 ECFR health conditions. For detailed analysis, we focused on one seed point, Sarcoidosis. From the Voronoi results, we identified 5,487 ICD-10 codes (data points) associated with Sarcoidosis (seed point). To evaluate these results, we compared them with Hannah's team's result, which contains 147 ICD-10 codes related to Sarcoidosis. Out of Voronoi's identified codes, 47 matched the existing list. While the match is limited, this result reflects some inherent challenges. Each data point is assigned to only one seed point region, which might not fully capture cases where data points could relate to multiple health conditions. Additionally, the dimensionality reduction step (PCA), though essential for visualization, may have contributed to minor distortions in the clustering.

numerals.found_text: Figure 42Â -Â Our ECE process generated 44,238 unique ICD-10 codes for 100 VASRD codes. After applying graph theory, we retained the 97.5th percentile of total ICD-10 codes (ECE output), resulting in 43,255 ICD-10 codes. We applied graph theory to these six conditions: Sarcoidosis, Brain Cancer, Asthma, Fibromyalgia, Irritable Bowel Syndrome, and Breast Cancer. For Sarcoidosis, Hannah's original set of 147 codes was narrowed down to 117 codes. Similarly, our ECE output for Sarcoidosis was refined from 2,564 to 2,289 codes after applying the same graph theory filtering, which comprehensively included all 117 of Hannah's codes.

numerals.found_text: This image displays Step 3 of the VASRD code(s) to Medical Code Mapping Tool, showing the final mapping from VASRD Code to ICD-10 codes. The "Filtered Clinical Codes" section presents a table of ICD-10 codes that have been identified as relevant to the disease(Sarcoidosis, VASRD code 6846). In this final step, the keywords generated in Step 2 are sent to the UMLS API, which maps them to relevant medical codes. These API results are then processed through a language model for post-filtering, which retains only the codes specifically related to the disease based on code descriptions while removing unrelated results.

all_issues.found_text: This diagram illustrates the VACM ECEU (Extraction, Compaction, Expansion, and UMLS API) workflow. Medical concepts are extracted from eCFR data, as shown in the above figure, and processed through an LLM to generate relevant medical keywords such as "Echocardiography," "Prednisone," and "Complete blood count." The expanded keywords are then mapped to standardized medical codes using the UMLS API, resulting in ICD-10 codes (e.g., R50.9 for Fever), CPT codes (e.g., 93306 for Echocardiography), RxNorm codes (e.g., 8640 for Prednisone), and LOINC codes (e.g., 718-7 for Complete Blood Count).

all_issues.found_text: Figure 29â€“ This stacked bar chart compares the performance of four embedding models - text-embedding-ada-002, BioBERT, PubMedBERT, and all-MiniLM-L6-v2 - in aligning ICD-10 code descriptions with the ECFR description of VASRD Code: 6846 (Sarcoidosis) using cosine similarity. Each bar represents 147 ICD-10 codes split into 'Matched Codes' (blue) and 'Missing Codes' (dark blue). text-embedding-ada-002 achieved 33 matches, all-MiniLM-L6-v2 had 28 matches, while BioBERT and PubMedBERT each matched only 1 code. PubMedBERT and BioBERT yielded fewer matches in the top 200 results because their embeddings focus on biomedical text, which may not align well with the regulatory and clinical language in the ECFR description, resulting in weaker semantic connections

all_issues.found_text: Figure 31Â â€“ Euclidean distance is used to measure the similarity between two points. In this analysis, vector embeddings were generated for the Sarcoidosis ECFR description and approximately 75,000 ICD-10 code descriptions using the text-embedding-3-large. Without applying normalization orÂ dimensionality reduction, the L2 norm isÂ calculated. ICD-10 Codes were sorted based on their L2 norm scores, with lower scores indicating higher similarity. The top 200 codes with the lowest L2 norm scores were compared to a curated list of 147 Sarcoidosis-related ICD-10 codes. Among the top 200 codes, 20 matched the curated list, and in the top 500, 29 codes matched.Â While the match is limited, refining the ECFR description by incorporating all known symptoms of Sarcoidosis using a LLM has the potential to improve the relevance and accuracy of the results.

all_issues.found_text: Figure 32Â -Â  In our analysis, Euclidean distance serves as a key metric to evaluate the semantic relationship between Sarcoidosis (Condition) and ICD-10 code descriptions across two distinct datasets: API output results and Hannah's codes. The API output encompasses 2,564 codes, while Hannah's dataset contains 147 thoroughly validated codes. Our Euclidean distance calculations revealed a distribution ranging from 0.4754 to 0.7904 in the API dataset and 0.4754 to 0.7617 in Hannah's dataset. Notably, the overlapping distance ranges indicate that Euclidean distance,Â may not provide optimal differentiation for identifying the 147 validated codes within the broader API Output Results.

all_issues.found_text: Figure 34Â â€“ The image shows the Voronoi polygon for Sarcoidosis.Â Voronoi is performed for 6 ECFR health conditions. For detailed analysis, we focused on one seed point, Sarcoidosis. From the Voronoi results, we identified 5,487 ICD-10 codes (data points) associated with Sarcoidosis (seed point). To evaluate these results, we compared them with Hannah's team's result, which contains 147 ICD-10 codes related to Sarcoidosis. Out of Voronoi's identified codes, 47 matched the existing list. While the match is limited, this result reflects some inherent challenges. Each data point is assigned to only one seed point region, which might not fully capture cases where data points could relate to multiple health conditions. Additionally, the dimensionality reduction step (PCA), though essential for visualization, may have contributed to minor distortions in the clustering.

40.found_text: Figure 29â€“ This stacked bar chart compares the performance of four embedding models - text-embedding-ada-002, BioBERT, PubMedBERT, and all-MiniLM-L6-v2 - in aligning ICD-10 code descriptions with the ECFR description of VASRD Code: 6846 (Sarcoidosis) using cosine similarity. Each bar represents 147 ICD-10 codes split into 'Matched Codes' (blue) and 'Missing Codes' (dark blue). text-embedding-ada-002 achieved 33 matches, all-MiniLM-L6-v2 had 28 matches, while BioBERT and PubMedBERT each matched only 1 code. PubMedBERT and BioBERT yielded fewer matches in the top 200 results because their embeddings focus on biomedical text, which may not align well with the regulatory and clinical language in the ECFR description, resulting in weaker semantic connections

42.found_text: Figure 31Â â€“ Euclidean distance is used to measure the similarity between two points. In this analysis, vector embeddings were generated for the Sarcoidosis ECFR description and approximately 75,000 ICD-10 code descriptions using the text-embedding-3-large. Without applying normalization orÂ dimensionality reduction, the L2 norm isÂ calculated. ICD-10 Codes were sorted based on their L2 norm scores, with lower scores indicating higher similarity. The top 200 codes with the lowest L2 norm scores were compared to a curated list of 147 Sarcoidosis-related ICD-10 codes. Among the top 200 codes, 20 matched the curated list, and in the top 500, 29 codes matched.Â While the match is limited, refining the ECFR description by incorporating all known symptoms of Sarcoidosis using a LLM has the potential to improve the relevance and accuracy of the results.

45.found_text: Figure 34Â â€“ The image shows the Voronoi polygon for Sarcoidosis.Â Voronoi is performed for 6 ECFR health conditions. For detailed analysis, we focused on one seed point, Sarcoidosis. From the Voronoi results, we identified 5,487 ICD-10 codes (data points) associated with Sarcoidosis (seed point). To evaluate these results, we compared them with Hannah's team's result, which contains 147 ICD-10 codes related to Sarcoidosis. Out of Voronoi's identified codes, 47 matched the existing list. While the match is limited, this result reflects some inherent challenges. Each data point is assigned to only one seed point region, which might not fully capture cases where data points could relate to multiple health conditions. Additionally, the dimensionality reduction step (PCA), though essential for visualization, may have contributed to minor distortions in the clustering.

74.found_text: This image displays Step 3 of the VASRD code(s) to Medical Code Mapping Tool, showing the final mapping from VASRD Code to ICD-10 codes. The "Filtered Clinical Codes" section presents a table of ICD-10 codes that have been identified as relevant to the disease(Sarcoidosis, VASRD code 6846). In this final step, the keywords generated in Step 2 are sent to the UMLS API, which maps them to relevant medical codes. These API results are then processed through a language model for post-filtering, which retains only the codes specifically related to the disease based on code descriptions while removing unrelated results.
